thread.section_title: Delco Times – Delco PA News, Sports, Weather and Things to Do
thread.title: Merry Christmas Fund

author: Colin Ainsworth
title: Merry Christmas Fund
text: Goal: $50,000 Given today: $600 Given to date: $19,926 CHESTER — Donations continued to arrive at the Salvation Army through Christmas week to benefit the 2023 Merry Christmas Fund. As the drive enters into its final days, the tally sits at just under 40 percent of its goal and 16 percent above the $17,210 given at this time last year. The Salvation Army Chester Corps will continue to accept donations through New Year’s Day. Today’s donors to the fund are: • Marvin and Ruth Ann Eyrich of Brookhaven, $100: In loving Memory of Jimmy Munson, Gary Nygard, Steven Zuzer. – Butch and Ruth Ann Eyrich • Adrienne and Richard Gallo of Media, $100: In loving memory of Casimir and Stella DeCwikiel; Rita, Vincent and Michael Gallo. • Donald Toy of Ridley Park, $100: Merry Christmas to Williams Family. Wayne, Ashley, Alec, Charley, Emma and Theo in Camp Pendleton, Calif. • Al and Barbara Hostetler of Media, $75: Merry Christmas and a healthy New Year! • Shirley Ostrander of Glen Riddle, $50: In loving memory of Jack from his wife, Shirley, and daughters Lin and Joyce. Gone but not forgotten. • Rose Petlikowski of Aston, $50. • Anonymous of Morton, $50. • Andrew and Barbara Kearney of Prospect Park, $50: In memory of Tim Reardon. – The Reardon’s and Kearney’s • Lynn Menta of Springfield, $25: In loving memory of my parents, Felix and Marie Siano. The Daily Times will provide daily updates showing the amount of donations received and list the names of contributors to the Merry Christmas Fund. Those who wish to be recognized should include a very brief, legible holiday message with their donations. Donations can be sent in the form of checks or money orders to: Salvation Army, P.O. Box 1032, Brookhaven, PA 19015. Please do not mail donations to the Daily Times.
